title: Pyke is what?
body: So not sure but is he undead? He doesnt look like it. He looks alive. So my question is, barring him being dead, how did he survive under water?

replies.body:
We're really..not sure..

Riot did a very good job of making it ambiguous as to what Pyke really even is. For one, they definitely don't give us a direct answer in the lore, and he has aspects of many different things. He's got to be a zombie, because he's physically real and litterally fucking slashes throats in bilgewater, right? Well yes, but actually no. He is physical but also..not physical..he can turn into a weird phasing thing that thinks it's a shark and honestly it's just weird and I don't like to think about it. Okay so if he's not a zombie then what, is he like a returned ghost like Mordekaiser? Welllll that doesn't really make sense either because for one how in the fuck would he escape daddy morde's land and for two he again has a somewhat physical body sooo..? So he's not dead, he just got his body and mind fucked with by fish magic? Well I don't know about you but he can do some REALLY WEIRD SHIT TO JUSTIFY VIA FISH MAGIC! 

I don't know what Pyke is, Riot doesn't know what Pyke is, and Pyke damn sure don't know what Pyke is

{{sticker:sg-zephyr}}
He is a "drowned".

He's an undead. He didn't survive. From his story, it sounds like the leviathans were able to take control of his spirit to do their bidding. Revenge for all their fellows who've been killed by whalers.
He's more of a revenant, not a ghost.

In one of the teasers we were able to see how he phased through the ground, with his knife looking out of the ground like a shark fin.

https://blind.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/blind-riot-games-champion-reveal-pyke-1.gif

So he is definitely not entirely corporeal like a revenant.

>Revenant - "In folklore, a revenant is an _animated corpse_ that is believed to have revived from death to **haunt the living.**"
>
>Ghost - "In folklore, a ghost (sometimes known as an apparition, haunt, phantom, poltergeist, shade, specter or spectre, spirit, spook, and wraith) is the soul or _spirit_ of a dead person or animal that **can appear** to the living."

 Generally speaking, ghosts are transparent beings that appear in order to manipulate or scare someone. A revenant is a reanimated corpse, someone who can be physically harmed but will keep coming back. A revenant isn't entirely corporeal, a ghost is. 

If Pyke couldn't be harmed by regular means, he would be a ghost. Since he can be killed by things like swords or guns and will keep returning, he is a revenant. 

 Is it a huge difference? Not really, but still.

How do you know that Pyke can be harmed by regular attacks?
He can be harmed within the game, but the same goes for the shadow isles champs, who were shown to be immune to physical attacks,unless they are made with demacian steel because of it's magic sealing properties, in the harrowing-story(and some of their color stories).

The only reason why you can harm him with physical attacks in the game is because it'd be otherwise impossible to balance him properly.

And a revenant is corporeal, his body merely reforms after being killed.

He is apparently undead, but it's not related to the curse of the shadow isles, hence why he looks so different.
We don't know what caused his transformation though.
He is something entirely new. I don't think he is undead.
It is pretty safe to say that he is undead. Just in a different way than the cursed Shadow Island, but still undead.

As he clearly states: "Captains told me to kill fish. Fish told me to kill captains. Makes sense." Everyone knows that fish don't talk, therefore fish couldn't have told him anything. But he says that this makes sense ("Makes sense." -Pyke, 2018). Thus, it is quite clear that he is insane... and that is how he survived underwater. QED.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=btEuIHwi,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-10T06:44:48.146+0000)
>
>Everyone knows that fish don't talk, therefore fish couldn't have told him anything. 

Well, Runeterra has things like {{champion:267}}, {{champion:105}} and {{champion:223}}, sure, they arent fish, but they look like fish.

So, its not crazy to think that a fish can talk in Runeterra.

I mean, there are other talking animals ({{champion:29}} for example)  in that world after all.

> [{quoted}](name=Ebonmaw Dragon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=btEuIHwi,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-08-10T06:50:38.407+0000)
>
> Well, Runeterra has things like {{champion:267}}, {{champion:105}} and {{champion:223}}, sure, they arent fish, but they look like fish.
> 
> So, its not crazy to think that a fish can talk in Runeterra.
> 
> I mean, there are other talking animals ({{champion:29}} for example)  in that world after all.

Pyke didn't say that things that looked like fish told him to kill captains. He said that fish, specifically, quote unquote, did such.

Pyke is crazy for thinking that a fish could be telling him anything - lucky for him, too, because being crazy allowed him to survive under water.

He also talks about how there is a swimming city.

What he is is one question, what happened isn't that complicated.

Pyke went overboard, most likely on purpose (a fish was involved though), as he sunk he was found by an actual intelligent fish people who saved him, and turned him to their side. Now he's essentially the protector of the fish people, fighting back against the surface dwellers who have been killing fish for, well, ever.

> [{quoted}](name=Teh Song,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=btEuIHwi,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-10T08:19:18.535+0000)
>
> He also talks about how there is a swimming city.
> 
> What he is is one question, what happened isn't that complicated.
> 
> Pyke went overboard, most likely on purpose, as he sunk he was found by an actual intelligent fish people who saved him, and turned him to their side. Now he's essentially the protector of the fish people, fighting back against the surface dwellers who have been killing fish for, well, ever.

https://xkcd.com/451/

Interesting hobby.
Is your joy in the process or the looks on their faces when they realize?

> [{quoted}](name=Teh Song,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=btEuIHwi,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-10T08:34:33.819+0000)
>
> Interesting hobby.
> Is your joy in the process or the looks on their faces when they realize?

Actually got kind of awkward when what was intended as a clear joke ("insanity = unable to drown") was taken seriously.

I don't exactly have a lot of faith in the ability of members of this community to be...... Well, let's just say it's not that I took it seriously but that I was willing to believe you meant it seriously

He's a revenant; a reanimated corpse that retains all his memories (compared to zombies which are mindless, or a ghost, which is just the soul without the body.)

He's dead, just really pissed off and not moving on or leaving his body for awhile.

Well first of all we don't know what he really is and how he got his power, but if you take a look at this passive , its called "Gift of the Drowned Ones", he also mentions a swimming  city and talking fish, doesn't that ring a bell?
Pyke is inspired from the Cthulhu mythos he is probably a servant of some old god that lies beneath the sea.

As some fellow players have written before me, What little we know about Pyke is that he is some kind of Revenant revived by Jaullfish Magic or maybe something even worse that we still don't know of. By his story, sapphilite seems to be related to him, being maybe the origin of his water-related powersas his eye does seem blue enough to pass as something similar to what the Jaullfish had inside.

Its just theory at this point, but he might be a corpse revived by sapphilite (forcefully introduced in his brain through the eye cavity) and controled as a puppet by the "fishes" that brought him back. It's unlucky that regarding the Lovecraftian tones around not only Pyke but also Bilgewater, we might never know the truth of the Swimming City

I can't find the story right now but I remember in a Nami story she needed to get a moon stone or something from the depths of the ocean and she saw a ghastly dark presence, could that presence be what resurrected and has allied with Pyke?

edit: https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Into_the_Abyss found it. 

apparently I forgot there's voidborn at the bottom of the seas, that would mean my theory points that pyke is possibly a voidborn now and I don't really like that idea....so forget it.
